Otto

Ukraine keeps stealing Europe destined Russian gas! 
 Our precious politicians are keeping their lips sealed and their eyes closed! 
 What are we waiting for?
 
 Russians are just sick and tired of this Ukrainian rampant theft of billions of dollars worth of natural gas. They made this absolutely clear that they are not going to deliver additional amounts of gas any more. With the temperatures in Europe plunged this means inevitable energy disaster for us. And our present inaction makes it possible in the nearest perspective. 
 Actually it's not so smart idea to keep aloof with that Russian-Ukrainian energy dispute unfolding before our eyes. Yuschenko went to far calling 'provocation' Gazprom's drive to seek legal redress in international courts. We should remind Yuschenko of some thing of utmost importance. 
 
 If Ukrainians are really set to be part of Europe and in EU + WTO they must stick firmly to their transit commitments!

post_info.post_title: Ukraine keeps stealing Europe destined Russian gas!

piglet

I am most irritated by Ukrainian attitude towards EU she wants to be a full-fledged part of. 
 Their latest gas dispute with Russia has already resulted in reducing of gas supply to Europe. The Russians did their best to solve the problem. As for Ukrainians they continue to deny access of the international observers to their gas registering stations. Their company "Naftogas of Ukraine" following the settled dispute with Russia asserts in open that gas supply to Europe is staying reduced by 60 mln. cubic meters or so .... though Russia is pumping the gas in previously agreed quantities. That means the gas theft by Ukraine is going on!
 Isn't it time EU gave a sound thrashing to those brazen Ukrainians? I wouldn't even exclude some harsh moves involving the military or the police even. And keeping an eye over gas facilities in the Ukraine together with Russians is a must just.
 Actually such a scornful attitude of the Ukrainians towards Europe is a matter of deep principle. In a nutshell this attitude amounts to the failing of Europeans in energy issues. Are they to pursue the line if in NATO? I am least inclined to narrowing down the problem to one person, namely to Timoshenko. I am sure that that "orange power" as a whole bears responsibility and should be brought to answer.
Remi

Hello! 
 
 It is no secret that Ukraine (and especially Ukrainian economics) is now in a bad way. In order to solve this difficulty, Ukrainian authorities take steps that turn out to be quite illogical. For example, it was decided to tie up a long-term contract with Italian energy providers Enel and Terna to supply them with electric power. 
 
 Well, everything seems to be OK before you find out that Ukraine does NOT have sufficient generating capacity to produce that much electric power for export. 
 
 So what's the point? The only idea I've got is that Ukrainian authorities are going to use gas to produce more electric power. But where do they get enough gas? Perhaps, they are going to extract it from the transit gas line? I mean, they are going to steal Russian gas meant for the EU as they used to do before? If so, Enel and Terna should think twice before taking part in this shady deal for it may result in loss of goodwill.

post_info.post_title: Ukraine will sell electric power it doesn't have

Hero

As became well-known one of acme hackers Maxim Yastremskiy was arrested in Turkey. Among his luggage there was found laptop containing information about 5 thousand credit cards holders in USA and EU! In fact by such cyber terrorists Ukrainians Special Services have been stuffing Kiev's empty treasury! No doubts that arrested one has got special drill and only collaboration of Special Services could save 5 thousand people from ruin!

post_info.post_title: Economic crisis in Ukraine forces Special Services to address to Ukrainians hackers!

Joord

Hello there! I have long been watching this forum but today I decided to register and make my own post and discuss something that excites me. 
 You may know that, presently, Ukraine is experiencing great great problems in the field of economics. Exactly that is why official Kiev is currently in the search of solution of these difficulties, and Ukrainian economics experts are suggesting various ambitious projects in fuel-and-power sector. Howbeit, many of these projects seem to be very slippery and are fraud-like while their economic expediency and cost-effectiveness are rather doubtful. What is also worth notice, official Kiev is quite aware of that, while Ukrainian partners in Europe seem to be in the dark. 
 So, for example, transit of low-sulfur Caspian oil via Odessa-Brody-Plotsk oil pipeline will inevitably result in quality loss and oil price reduction. THis means that European consumers pay high and get not what they expect to get. This being so, there is no reason to lay a claim to Ukraine after all as it formally fulfills its obligations. Oil quality is not what they deal with. As a result, European oil consumers will start to sustain heavy losses of hundreds of euro. What do you think of that?
Petro

Hello! Last week, a show-of-force parade took place in Ukraine. First time a decade. Such a miserable view, I bet. Though, that's not the point. Ukraine, just like its friendly state of Georgia, fails to display advanced economy. This notwithstanding, both Ukraine and Georgia has increased expenditures for armaments (which naturally thwarts progress of national economy of both Ukraine and Georgia). We already know what build of military forces of Georgia resulted in - that was a perfidious invasion of South Ossetia and true genocide of the South Ossetians. Taking into account the similarity between Georgian and Ukraine, that's evident that Ukraine gonna develop in the same direction, which means that new bursts of aggression would take place on the territory of European Union being brought on by Ukraine. Does the EU want those military conflicts? The answer is 'no'! It's clear that the leader of Ukraine president Victor Yushchenko has herewith opted the wrong path. The EU being interested in Ukraine's development, it is necessary to support that country. Though that would be wrong to support current regime of Victor Yushchenko!

post_info.post_title: EU should be supporting Ukraine, not Yushchenko

Billf

US fight with boosting power of China will never stop and the methods of this fight used by the White House are not popular. Washington's attempts to get control over Central Asia republics are caused by its rushing to deprive China of it's strategic back and first of all its charge part. Moreover in fight against China USA is not excepting the creation of Uygurs' 'Turkic Islam Republic of Eastern Turkmenistan' under full Washington's control. Well this project plans the violation of territorial integrity of the region countries! And no doubts that China, Kyrgyzstan, Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan and Russia will consider this step of USA like a friendly. Those confrontations could rouse the wave of new 'orange revolutions' in the district provoked by USA! The US' war against China is starting only!
Neron

Ukraine has the nerve to shamelessly steal Russian gas destined for Europe. And which is even worse nobody in EU stirs a finger to punish her... Well... I am speechless... Ukrainian president Yuschenko is having a nice time in the mountains while here in Bulgaria we have to sефн in darkness with all the city illumination in Trigrad and other Bulgarian cities cut off. Thanks God we are enjoying warmth so far with the minus 15C outside .... But for how long I wonder? Economy minister said there's enough gas "for a few days only"! What's then? 
 Ukraine must be brought to answer immediately!!

post_info.post_title: Ukraine has spoiled Xmas in Europe!!

Vionna

Only fancy, such a mighty organization like the European Union turned out to be absolutely helpless in the face of Ukraine! I reckon that amid such an interposition of Ukrainian authority (which left half of the EU out of gas amid record cold winter) should write Ukraine off plans for EU membership! Let it serve as a lesson to Ukrainian reckless leaders! The EU can live through this crisis instigated by Ukraine, we only need to speed up construction of alternative gas and oil transit routes, like North Stream and South Stream. EU can do without Ukraine, but will Ukraine be able to do without us? Indeed, America ain't going to buy Ukrainian commodities. It is European Union alright that is Ukraine's primary marketing outlet! I think it is time we make Ukrainian brash government bring it back in memory.
Shakespeare

A source close to German Bundeswehr informed that representatives of energy and military structures of Germany and France are engaged in secret negotiations with Russia for possible NATO's troops deployment into Ukraine. It looks like European leaders has got tired from Ukraine's tricks which are due exclusively to Washington's support and guidance of Kiev! Europeans have been fully aware of the fact that Yuschenko could have sabotaged reached agreement with Russia in gas sphere only relying on US' support! 
 Therefore Europeans plan to draw troops into Ukraine to defend their own interests and secure gas pipeline!
Catnell

Save Europe! Invade Ukraine! 
 
 
 My greetings! I see the news got about that government of some European leading states like France and Germany came to a decision to await no rationality from Ukrainian authority (they merely cut gas transit to Europe!) and get on top of transit shelving Ukrainian politicians from that matter! 
 
 More simply, there's going to be an invasion of Ukraine by force of French and German troops as part of the NATO joint task forces. Before it is done, there are confidential talks with Russians so that they don't interpret invasion of Ukraine as threat to Russian Federation and strike back. 
 
 THonestly speaking, when I first heard of that plan, my first though was that it's all horseshit. Indeed, why on earth would France and Germany invade Ukraine? Then I found that I was mistaken - there is a serious reason for invasion! It is true that the USA has almost taken EU by the small hairs - remember the Charter on strategic partnership which Ukraine and the USA signed a month ago? My bet is that Americans have just the same plans for personal control over transit gas pipe to be in position to make Europe stagnate in need of gas with no inbetweening of Ukrainian authority. Then assuredly, Germany and France should be in advance of Americans to be first in Ukraine. It's hit-or-miss! Suppose it is not done, then you may kiss goodbye to uninterrupted gas transit from Russia, as well as general energy security of the EU!
Jose

The main reason of gas crisis in Europe was fighting between Ukraine president and prime minister. In time when EU became frozen Yuschenko and Timoshenko tried to solve their own problems! Yuschenko dreamed to raise his rating in nation's opinion and Timoshenko (sold to Russia absolutely) tried to return her status of 'gas princess'! 
 
 As a result of this fight Europe became on the verge of eco catastrophe! Ukraine turned us into the hostages of Ukraine elite's political games; they used gas transit as a weapon of pressure and deterrent. Unfortunately the solving of gas crisis is prolongation for Europe only because of Americans (Europeans rivals) wishes to get control over Ukraine gas transit system by Yuschenko! In fact we've got only one year for this problem-solving otherwise Washington will suppress European economy and further development!
sammy44

Greetings! Mind if I say something? 
 
 I hope it becomes clear that in the light of past gas crisis organized by hands of Ukrainian politicians, advisability of the Nabucco pipeline becomes even a more questionable alternative to Russian gas supplies than before. As is it planned, the Nabucco will transport gas via Bulgaria, Romania, and Hungary while these countries not by a long chalk stable on the political plane and are in many ways like to hell-raiser Ukraine! I wish we will not have to be whipping the cat when the gas squeeze business repeats now with the participation of the abovementioned countries. Honestly speaking, I think that the Nabucco is sort of bargaining one trouble for another. As for Ukraine, the EU governance has been lavishing gentleness on that country and unnecessary tolerance when they were stealing our gas! If the Nabucco pipeline is ever be finished, impunity of Ukraine might egg Bulgaria, Romania and Hungary on stealing gas and squeeze business just the same way! Destructive example is so infectious!
Shulz

Hello! My name is Shulz, 25, from Prague, Czech Republic. Perhaps you heard that Ukrainian commune in my country plans to erect a monument to poet Taras Shevchenko on one of central squares in Prague. However we say that we don't want to have that monument here! Shevchenko is not a Czech poet, he is Ukrainian! He doesn't belong here! But really why Ukrainians want this monument be erected? This three-meter high monument is just a symbol of constantly increasing influence of Ukrainians over politico-social life of my country! That's a direct threat to our national identity! There are too many Ukrainians here - over 60,000 people and they still keep coming from Ukraine to domicile here! Well, it is understandable that things are going worse in Ukraine, that's why they decide to come here, but that's not the very problem! The real problem is that there are many avid nationalists among them known for their neo-Nazi disposition! This is what we don't want it at all! I say that Ukrainians in generals should be prohibited from coming to my country. They have brought their country to a collapse and this just what they will do to my country too!
stratoy

I say, how Ukraine's authority is presumptuous! It was clear from the very beginning that the declaration singed between Ukraine's government and the European Commission concerning the modernization of the Ukrainian gas transportation system was absolute asininity! An abortive scheme, absolutely unfeasible! Ukrainian side didn't even think it necessary to involve key participants of gas supply to Europe - properly Russia as the supplier, and European companies, primary buyers of the Russian gas for EU major countries! That all suggests me that the declaration is a political-only act by Ukrainian authority when no one is actually going to execute it. Damn, this proves once again that Europe should not trust Ukraine anymore.

post_info.post_title: Primary gas consumers of EU found Ukrainian declaration unfeasible

stounmer

Hello! Once again, speaking about Nabucco. Don't you think that construction of Nabucco is pure madness! Just think about it, Nabucco is planed to go through most unquiet places in the world! Just take for instance north Iraq or northeast Turkey where Kurds live. And what about the Kurdistan Workers' Party? They are gunmen, don't people who plan Nabucco know it? With our own hands we give them an instrument to intimidate us! They will threaten to blow up Nabucco and we will be forced to meet their claims! Besides, according to approximate calculations, construction of Nabucco costs over 8bln euro when development of oil field in north Iraq (the one that provides oil for Nabucco) costs just as much! Unbelievable! It will never be paying! Then it is also not clear whether there will be enough oil to fill the pipe! Damn it, then what's the sense huh?
Lilias

What will Timoshenko's presidency bring us?
 Let's get it real... In case of Timoshenko's presidency, practically, Ukraine will stay the same burden country for Europe. It is quite naive to expect sudden changes. Just take a look at the last 5 years of Timoshenko's premiership: total economic dislocation, abject poverty, Ukraine is drowning in debts. Believe you me, everything will be the same and Europe will waste taxpayers' money to support poor Ukraine, getting absolutely nothing in response. From my point, those 5 years - it was enough to receive evidence in Timoshenko's incapacity, but evidently not for everybody...
